Class DOUBLE

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Connectors.DOUBLE
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Connectors
public class DOUBLE extends Object implements Connectors, Serializable
The DOUBLE class represents a type of connector for tiles in the game and implements the Connectors interface. This class is a singleton and provides methods to validate compatibility and adjacency rules specific to the DOUBLE connector type. This connector type has the following characteristics: - It is considered legal for connections with DOUBLE and UNIVERSAL connectors. - It supports adjacency with DOUBLE and UNIVERSAL connectors. - It is exposed. The class is annotated with @JsonTypeName to support JSON serialization and deserialization using the type name "DOUBLE". Methods: - getInstance(): Returns the singleton instance of DOUBLE. - checkLegal(Connectors Adjacent): Evaluates if the connection is legal with a given adjacent connector. - checkAdjacent(Connectors Adjacent): Determines adjacency compatibility with another connector. - isExposed(): Indicates whether this connector is exposed.
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • INSTANCE

      public static final DOUBLE INSTANCE
      Singleton instance of the DOUBLE class. The INSTANCE variable provides access to the sole instance of the DOUBLE class. This instance represents a connector of type "DOUBLE" in the game and enforces the following behaviors: - Connections with adjacent connectors are considered legal for DOUBLE and UNIVERSAL connector types. - Adjacency is supported with DOUBLE and UNIVERSAL connectors. - This connector type is exposed. The INSTANCE variable ensures thread-safe and global access to the singular instance.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static DOUBLE getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the DOUBLE class. This method provides access to the unique instance of the DOUBLE connector type, ensuring that the class adheres to the singleton design pattern. This instance represents the predefined rules and states specific to the DOUBLE connector type, as defined in the game's logic.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance of DOUBLE

    • checkLegal

      public boolean checkLegal(Connectors Adjacent)
      Evaluates whether the connection to the specified adjacent connector is legal for the current connector type.
      Specified by:
      checkLegal in interface Connectors
      Parameters:
      Adjacent - the connector to evaluate legality with
      Returns:
      true if the connection to the given adjacent connector is legal, otherwise false

    • checkAdjacent

      public boolean checkAdjacent(Connectors Adjacent)
      Determines whether the current connector is adjacent to the given connector. Adjacency is evaluated based on the compatibility rules of the DOUBLE and UNIVERSAL connector types.
      Specified by:
      checkAdjacent in interface Connectors
      Parameters:
      Adjacent - the connector to check adjacency against
      Returns:
      true if the given connector is either DOUBLE or UNIVERSAL; false otherwise

    • isExposed

      public boolean isExposed()
      Determines whether this connector is exposed. This method defines the "exposed" status of the connector, where being exposed typically indicates whether the connector is in an active or visible state. For this implementation, the method always returns true, signifying that the connector is exposed.
      Specified by:
      isExposed in interface Connectors
      Returns:
      true, indicating that this connector is exposed.
